channel.title: attack.t1505.003 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1505.003 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Webshell Recon Detection Via CommandLine & Processes
item.description: Looking for processes spawned by web server components that indicate reconnaissance by popular public domain webshells for whether perl, python or wget are installed.

item.title: Webshell Remote Command Execution
item.description: Detects posible command execution by web application/web shell

item.title: Execution in Webserver Root Folder
item.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in a web service root folder (filter out false positives)

item.title: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
item.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

item.title: Shells Spawned by Web Servers
item.description: Web servers that spawn shell processes could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or an other attack

item.title: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords
item.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells

item.title: Oracle WebLogic Exploit
item.description: Detects access to a webshell dropped into a keystore folder on the WebLogic server

item.title: Webshell Detection by Keyword
item.description: Detects webshells that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

item.title: Antivirus Web Shell Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a web shell

item.title: Webshell ReGeorg Detection Via Web Logs
item.description: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.
